channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024120054
item.description:
Report E-2024120054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 3, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1760 were crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remove any product. All waste and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120332
item.description:
Report X-2024120332

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Nov 25th during the PM sort a package was discovered to be leaking. The package was marked and labeled as UN1760 Corrosive Liquid, n.o.s.(Phosphous Acid), 8, PGIII. The package contained 4 one gallon plastic bottles and one of them leaked. The package has been placed into a salvage drum and an amended shippers dec has been requested.

item.title: Report X-2024120398
item.description:
Report X-2024120398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: SAVANNAH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UPON INSPECTION OF FOUR AIR PACKAGES, WE DISCOVERED INNER BOXES WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKINGS. THESE INNER LIMITED QUANTITY MARKED PACKAGES CONTAIN JUST FOR ME TEXTURE SOFTENERS AND SUPER OLIVE MIRACLE HAIR KITS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES, ONLY THE INNER BOXES ARE MARKED GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1Z4381380157703751, 1Z4381380157747464 AND 1Z4381380156149808. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024120344
item.description:
Report X-2024120344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: SAVANNAH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FOUR AIR PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED TO FIND INNER BOXES MARKED AS GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY. THE INNER MARKED LIMITED QUANTITY PACKAGES CONTAINED FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CONSORT FOR MEN HAIRSPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOXES TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE ARE 1Z4381380155012706, 1Z4381380155032471 AND 1Z4381380157601094. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024120025
item.description:
Report E-2024120025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-22
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 22, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3082 had a damaged valve and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. he crew began to gravity transfer the damaged tote into a new tote. HES deconstructed the damaged tote and placed the material into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew added the waste to the facilities waste inventory and demobilized from the site.
